comments:
I am not sure if this problem can be reproduced in other test suite types.
I have a custom test type that extends the "org.eclipse.hyades.ui.typeDescriptions" extension point. I created a handler that extends the "org.eclipse.hyades.test.core.launchconfigRunHandler". The handler opens the Test Log viewer before executing my test. During the execution, I sometimes get a NullPointerException. This NPE is only seen after I implemented my handler to open the Test Log viewer just before running a test. Below is the trace:

Debug args: -Xdebug -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=y,address=1142 -Dhyades.runner.agentName=org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.XMLExecutionDataProcessor  org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -application com.ibm.ccl.soa.test.ct.runner.uiTestApplication -location "default" -timeoutReuse -1 -testApplication org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench -data "D:/constellation/eclipse/test-workspace" -configuration file:C:/DOCUME~1/ADMINI~1/LOCALS~1/Temp/flannanl/tptp-configuration/ -os win32 -arch x86 -ws win32 -nl en_CA

Joe, could you take a look at this one.  Not sure about this usage pattern, and what component to redirect to.  Leaving it with the generic test execution component for now.

I believe this exception indicates that you are sending execution fragments without specifying a valid parentID.  If you want the events to appear at the root of the execution history, you must specify the special ID "ROOT", and otherwise, you must specify the ID of an event that has previously been model loaded.

Please consult the schema for the XML fragments for more information.  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=42824

I am closing this an invalid, but please feel free to contact me directly if the above doesn't make sense.

The Test Execution Events Schema is also available at:

http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/ >> TPTP Platform >> Technical documentation
ACTION: Please update the target to the release AND iteration that this defect was returned/fixed.
